level.text: The recovery of damages from the alleged offender shall not prohibit criminal prosecution of the alleged offender.
The recovery of civil damages by a merchant or a finding of liability under this subchapter shall not be admissible in a criminal proceeding.
A conviction or plea of guilty of fraud, shoplifting, or theft is not a prerequisite to the maintenance of a civil action authorized by this subchapter.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 9-132
level.text: Law 9-132, the "Retired Police Officer Redeployment Temporary Amendment Act of 1992," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-487. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 7, 1992, and May 6, 1992, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 28, 1992, it was assigned Act No. 9-217 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-132 became effective on July 22, 1992.
